title: Best Open Source Data Governance AI Tools - Top Picks for 2025
metaDescription: Discover the 7 best open source data governance AI tools in 2025. Compare features, pricing & reviews to find the perfect tool for your needs.
introduction: Looking for the best open source data governance AI tools in 2025? We've analyzed hundreds of tools to bring you this curated list of the top 7 options. Whether you're a developer, business, or individual user, this guide helps you choose the right open source data governance AI tool.

platforms.name: DataHub
platforms.description: DataHub is an open-source metadata platform originally developed at LinkedIn and now maintained by Acryl Data. It provides a unified system for data discovery, observability, and governance by ingesting, searching, and visualizing technical, operational, and social metadata in real-time. Its key differentiator is its stream-based, real-time metadata architecture (MAE/MCP) that enables immediate reflection of changes across the data ecosystem, making it particularly suited for modern, dynamic data stacks.
keyFeatures: Stream-based real-time metadata ingestion via Kafka (Metadata Audit Event & Change Proposal)
End-to-end column-level data lineage visualization and tracking
Powerful search and discovery with filtering by tags, owners, domains, and glossary terms

platforms.name: Great Expectations
platforms.description: Great Expectations is an open-source Python library that helps data teams build trust in their data through automated validation, documentation, and profiling. It enables users to define, test, and enforce data quality expectations, integrating seamlessly into data pipelines and workflows to catch issues early. Its unique value lies in providing a shared, human-readable language for data quality, fostering collaboration between data engineers, scientists, and analysts.
keyFeatures: Define and manage data quality expectations as versioned, human-readable YAML or JSON files
Automatically generate data profiles and documentation from data sources (e.g., Pandas, Spark, SQL databases)
Integrate validation checks into CI/CD pipelines, orchestration tools (Airflow, dbt), and data catalogs

platforms.name: MOSTLY AI
platforms.description: MOSTLY AI is a synthetic data generation platform that enables organizations to create highly accurate, privacy-safe synthetic versions of their real-world datasets. Its core capabilities include generating high-fidelity synthetic tabular, time-series, and visual data while mathematically guaranteeing privacy through differential privacy and its proprietary TabularARGN model. It uniquely targets enterprises in regulated industries like finance, insurance, and healthcare, providing an open-source SDK for transparency and control, making it a leader in privacy-preserving data synthesis.
keyFeatures: Synthetic Tabular Data Generation with proprietary TabularARGN (Adversarial Regressor Graph Network) model
Differential Privacy guarantees with mathematically proven privacy bounds
Open-source Synthetic Data SDK (SDK) for Python, allowing for local, transparent data generation

platforms.name: Amundsen
platforms.description: Amundsen is an open-source data discovery and metadata engine originally developed by Lyft. It provides a centralized search and catalog interface for data assets (tables, dashboards, streams) across an organization, enabling users to find, understand, and trust data. Its key capabilities include automated metadata ingestion, data lineage visualization, and usage-driven ranking, uniquely focusing on improving data productivity and reducing time spent searching for data.
keyFeatures: Automated metadata ingestion from sources like Apache Atlas, AWS Glue, and databases
Search interface with ranking based on usage patterns (e.g., frequent queries, popularity)
Column-level lineage tracking to visualize data flow and dependencies

platforms.name: CTGAN
platforms.description: CTGAN (Conditional Tabular Generative Adversarial Network) is an open-source Python library for generating high-quality synthetic tabular data that mimics the statistical properties and complex relationships of real datasets. It is specifically designed to handle mixed data types (continuous and discrete columns) and skewed distributions, making it uniquely capable of preserving privacy while enabling data augmentation and sharing. Its primary audience includes data scientists, researchers, and developers working in environments with sensitive or limited data.
keyFeatures: Generates synthetic tabular data preserving column distributions and correlations
Handles mixed data types (continuous, discrete, categorical) natively
Uses conditional vectors and training-by-sampling to address imbalanced data

platforms.name: Unstructured
platforms.description: Unstructured is an open-source library and API platform for ingesting and pre-processing documents and images into clean, structured data for AI applications. It specializes in extracting text, tables, and metadata from hundreds of file formats (PDFs, PPTX, HTML, emails, images) and chunking content for optimal use with LLMs and RAG systems. Its unique value lies in its battle-tested, production-ready connectors and its ability to handle complex, real-world document layouts where other tools fail.
keyFeatures: Pre-built connectors for 50+ sources (S3, Google Drive, SharePoint, Azure, etc.)
Native support for 100+ file types (PDF, DOCX, PPTX, JPG, PNG, HTML, Emails)
Intelligent document partitioning and chunking strategies for LLM context windows

platforms.name: Annotorious
platforms.description: Annotorious is a free, open-source JavaScript library for adding image annotation capabilities directly to web applications. It provides a lightweight, embeddable interface for drawing shapes (polygons, rectangles, points) and attaching labels or comments to images, enabling collaborative annotation workflows. Its unique value lies in its developer-first approach, offering seamless integration into existing web projects without requiring a standalone platform or complex backend.
keyFeatures: Embeddable JavaScript library for web apps
Client-side image annotation (rectangles, polygons, points, freehand)
Real-time collaboration via WebSocket or external services

howToChoose: Define your specific needs and use cases for open source data governance AI tools
Consider your budget and team size
Evaluate required integrations with existing tools
Check free trials or free tiers before committing
Read user reviews and case studies
verdict: All 7 open source data governance AI tools on this list are excellent choices, each with unique strengths. DataHub leads with metadata-management, while Great Expectations offers data-quality. Your best choice depends on your specific requirements, budget, and technical expertise.
